Anak Sulit Makan? Ini Tips Ahli Gizi agar Terhindar dari Stunting
05 Nov 2019, 14:28 by Antara, Mila Novita
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Anak yang mengalami susah makan harus diberi perhatian lebih agar kebutuhan nutrisinya terpenuhi. Kekurangan nutrisi bisa menyebabkan anak kerdil atau stunting.
Halitu diungkapkan ahli gizi dari Universitas Tanjungpura Pontianak, Rahmania. “Dengan gizi terpenuhi maka bisa mencegah atau terhindar dari kekerdilan. Kekerdilan sendiri adalah ketika anak di usia 0 – 5 tahun gagal tumbuh maksimal atau kondisi di mana tinggi badan seseorang jauh lebih pendek dibandingkan tinggi badan orang seusia nya," ujarnya di Pontianak, Selasa, 5 November 2019.
Ia menjelaskan bahwa pendekatan yang bisa dilakukan antara lain variasi untuk makanan anak, sayur dicampur dengan bahan makanan lainnya, bentuk dan warna makanan yang menarik dan termasuk alat makan untuk menghidangkan makanan anak juga harus menarik agar buah hati ikut tertarik untuk makan.
"Perlu diperhatikan juga dan selama ini kita tidak memperhatikan bahwa anak itu banyak meniru orang tua. Sehingga orang tua juga harus memberikan contoh yang baik. Buah hati akan ikut makan orang tua misalnya seperti waktu makan bersama," ujar dia.
Secara umum ia menilai pola makan yang sehat merupakan satu kunci yang dapat mencegah kekerdilan pada anak.
"Untuk mencegah kekerdilan pola makan yang sehat satu di antara solusinya. Umumnya untuk masyarakat luas Indonesia punya pedoman yang namanya piring makanku dan tumpeng gizi. Di situ diberikan contoh secara visual, dalam sehari seberapa banyak yang harus dikonsumsi, juga persentase satu zat gizi terhadap yang lain," kata dia.
Menurut dia, banyak ibu muda yang percaya ilmu atau informasi yang dibagikan di media sosial. Kadang informasi tersebut tidak disertai penelitian. "Akan tetapi karena dibagikan oleh akun yang terkenal banyak percaya. Jadi pola yang diterapkan juga memang kurang tepat," kata dia.
Ia menambahkan kasus kekerdilan tidak semestinya soal mapan atau tidaknya orang tua si anak. Kadang juga kepada persoalan pola asuh. Jika orang tua yang mapan sibuk dengan pekerjaannya dan si anak dijaga nenek atau menggunakan jasa asisten rumah tangga atau lainnya.
"Belum lagi ada anak suka ngemil dan karena ngemil ia kenyang. Ia ngemil tadi dari sisi kebutuhan gizi tidak mencukupi. Orang tua menyuruh makan yang sehat ia sudah kenyang. Nah, itu yang perlu juga diperhatikan," jelas dia.
ANTARA

Difficult Children to Eat? These Nutritionist Tips to Avoid Stunting
05 Nov 2019, 14:28 by Antara, Mila Novita
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Children who experience difficulty in eating should be given more attention so that their nutritional needs are met. Malnutrition can cause stunted or stunted children.
This was revealed by a nutritionist from the Tanjungpura University of Pontianak, Rahmania. "With nutrition fulfilled, it can prevent or avoid dwarfism. Stunt itself is when children aged 0 - 5 years fail to grow optimally or a condition where a person's height is much shorter than the height of his age, "he said in Pontianak, Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
He explained that the approaches that could be done include variations for children's food, vegetables mixed with other food ingredients, interesting shapes and colors of food and including cutlery to serve children's food should also be interesting so that the baby is interested in eating.
"It should be noted as well and so far we have not noticed that the child imitates a lot of parents. So that parents also have to give a good example. Babies will eat parents for example, such as eating together," he said.
In general, he considered a healthy eating pattern is one key that can prevent stunt in children.
"To prevent the stunt of healthy eating one of the solutions. Generally for the wider community of Indonesia, they have guidelines called my meal plate and nutritional rice cone. There is given a visual example, how much should be consumed in a day, also the percentage of one nutrient to which another, "he said.
According to him, many young mothers who believe in knowledge or information shared on social media. Sometimes this information is not accompanied by research. "However, because it is shared by a well-known account many believe. So the pattern applied is also not quite right," he said.
He added that cases of stunt should not be a matter of whether or not the child's parents are well established. Sometimes also the issue of parenting. If an established parent is busy with work and the child is taken care of by the grandmother or using the services of a household assistant or others.
"Not to mention there are children who like snacking and because of snacking he is full. He snacked earlier in terms of insufficient nutritional needs. Parents told to eat healthy he was full. Now, that should also be considered," he explained.
